abstract: New York City Comptroller Scott M Stringer releases report finding that personal-injury and other tort claims filed annually against New York Police Department rose to record-setting 9,448 in 2014; says preliminary review of more recent fiscal data shows decrease of 11 percent in such claims, which include civil rights violations and other police misconduct.
lead_paragraph: The city comptroller’s office also found that preliminary data for the most recent fiscal year indicated an 11 percent decrease in personal-injury and other tort claims.

headline.main: Record Number of Claims Filed Against New York Police a Year Ago, a Report Says
headline.print_headline: Claims Against Police Soar, Then Dip
